deceased.domicile: live (domicile) permanently in England or Wales

declaration.accept: I confirm that I will administer the estate of the person who died according to law, and that my application is truthful.
declaration.confirm: We confirm that we will administer the estate of Dee Ceased, according to law. We will:
declaration.requests: If the probate registry (court) asks us to do so, we will:
declaration.confirmItem2: keep full details (an inventory) of the estate
declaration.confirmItem3: keep a full account of how the estate has been administered
declaration.requestsItem1: provide the full details of the estate and how it has been administered
declaration.requestsItem2: return the grant of probate to the court
declaration.submitWarning: Once everyone has agreed the legal statement and made their declaration, this information can’t be changed.
declaration.understandItem1: our application will be rejected if we do not answer any questions about the information we have given
declaration.understandItem2: criminal proceedings for fraud may be brought against us if we are found to have been deliberately untruthful or dishonest

legalStatement.intro: This statement is based on the information Lead Applicant has given in their application. It will be stored as a public record.
legalStatement.deceased: Dee Ceased was born on 1 January 1930 and died on 1 January 2018, domiciled in England and Wales.
legalStatement.applicant: We, Lead Applicant of Lead Applicant Address and Number 2 of Number 2 Address, make the following statement:

executorsApplying.name: Lead Applicant, an executor named in the will, is applying for probate.
executorsApplying.sign: Lead Applicant will sign and send to the probate registry what they believe to be the true and original last will and testament of Dee Ceased.

executorsApplying.name: Number 2, an executor named in the will, is applying for probate.
executorsApplying.sign: Number 2 will sign a photocopy of what they believe to be the true and original last will and testament of Dee Ceased. Lead Applicant will send the signed photocopy to the probate registry.

legalStatement.deceasedEstateLand: To the best of our knowledge, information and belief, there was no land vested in Dee Ceased which was settled previously to the death (and not by the will) of Dee Ceased and which remained settled land notwithstanding such death.
legalStatement.deceasedEstateValue: The gross value for the estate amounts to £123000 and the net value for the estate amounts to £123000.
